00013   bool Compound_Selector::operator<(const Compound_Selector& rhs) const

00016     // ugly
00017     return const_cast<Compound_Selector*>(this)->perform(&to_string) <
00018            const_cast<Compound_Selector&>(rhs).perform(&to_string);

00028   bool Complex_Selector::operator==(const Complex_Selector& rhs) const {
00029     // TODO: We have to access the tail directly using tail_ since ADD_PROPERTY doesn't provide a const version.
00030 
00031     const Complex_Selector* pOne = this;
00032     const Complex_Selector* pTwo = &rhs;
00033 
00034     // Consume any empty references at the beginning of the Complex_Selector
00035     if (pOne->combinator() == Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF && pOne->head()->is_empty_reference()) {
00036       pOne = pOne->tail_;
00037     }
00038     if (pTwo->combinator() == Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF && pTwo->head()->is_empty_reference()) {
00039       pTwo = pTwo->tail_;
00040     }
00041 
00042     while (pOne && pTwo) {
00043       if (pOne->combinator() != pTwo->combinator()) {
00044         return false;
00045       }
00046 
00047       if (*(pOne->head()) != *(pTwo->head())) {
00048         return false;
00049       }
00050 
00051       pOne = pOne->tail_;
00052       pTwo = pTwo->tail_;
00053     }
00054 
00055     return pOne == NULL && pTwo == NULL;
00056   }

00058   Compound_Selector* Compound_Selector::unify_with(Compound_Selector* rhs, Context& ctx)
00059   {
00060     Compound_Selector* unified = rhs;
00061     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00062     {
00063       if (!unified) break;
00064       else          unified = (*this)[i]->unify_with(unified, ctx);
00065     }
00066     return unified;
00067   }

00069   bool Simple_Selector::operator==(const Simple_Selector& rhs) const
00070   {
00071     // Compare the string representations for equality.
00072 
00073     // Cast away const here. To_String should take a const object, but it doesn't.
00074     Simple_Selector* pLHS = const_cast<Simple_Selector*>(this);
00075     Simple_Selector* pRHS = const_cast<Simple_Selector*>(&rhs);
00076 
00077     To_String to_string;
00078     return pLHS->perform(&to_string) == pRHS->perform(&to_string);
00079   }

00081   bool Simple_Selector::operator<(const Simple_Selector& rhs) const {
00082     // Use the string representation for ordering.
00083 
00084     // Cast away const here. To_String should take a const object, but it doesn't.
00085     Simple_Selector* pLHS = const_cast<Simple_Selector*>(this);
00086     Simple_Selector* pRHS = const_cast<Simple_Selector*>(&rhs);
00087 
00088     To_String to_string;
00089     return pLHS->perform(&to_string) < pRHS->perform(&to_string);
00090   }

00092   Compound_Selector* Simple_Selector::unify_with(Compound_Selector* rhs, Context& ctx)
00093   {
00094     To_String to_string(&ctx);
00095     for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00096     { if (perform(&to_string) == (*rhs)[i]->perform(&to_string)) return rhs; }
00097 
00098     // check for pseudo elements because they need to come last
00099     size_t i, L;
00100     bool found = false;
00101     if (typeid(*this) == typeid(Pseudo_Selector) || typeid(*this) == typeid(Wrapped_Selector))
00102     {
00103       for (i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00104       {
00105         if ((typeid(*(*rhs)[i]) == typeid(Pseudo_Selector) || typeid(*(*rhs)[i]) == typeid(Wrapped_Selector)) && (*rhs)[L-1]->is_pseudo_element())
00106         { found = true; break; }
00107       }
00108     }
00109     else
00110     {
00111       for (i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00112       {
00113         if (typeid(*(*rhs)[i]) == typeid(Pseudo_Selector) || typeid(*(*rhs)[i]) == typeid(Wrapped_Selector))
00114         { found = true; break; }
00115       }
00116     }
00117     if (!found)
00118     {
00119       Compound_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(*rhs);
00120       (*cpy) << this;
00121       return cpy;
00122     }
00123     Compound_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(rhs->pstate());
00124     for (size_t j = 0; j < i; ++j)
00125     { (*cpy) << (*rhs)[j]; }
00126     (*cpy) << this;
00127     for (size_t j = i; j < L; ++j)
00128     { (*cpy) << (*rhs)[j]; }
00129     return cpy;
00130   }

00132   Compound_Selector* Type_Selector::unify_with(Compound_Selector* rhs, Context& ctx)
00133   {
00134     // TODO: handle namespaces
00135 
00136     // if the rhs is empty, just return a copy of this
00137     if (rhs->length() == 0) {
00138       Compound_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(rhs->pstate());
00139       (*cpy) << this;
00140       return cpy;
00141     }
00142 
00143     // if this is a universal selector and rhs is not empty, just return the rhs
00144     if (name() == "*")
00145     { return new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(*rhs); }
00146 
00147 
00148     Simple_Selector* rhs_0 = (*rhs)[0];
00149     // otherwise, this is a tag name
00150     if (typeid(*rhs_0) == typeid(Type_Selector))
00151     {
00152       // if rhs is universal, just return this tagname + rhs's qualifiers
00153       if (static_cast<Type_Selector*>(rhs_0)->name() == "*")
00154       {
00155         Compound_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(rhs->pstate());
00156         (*cpy) << this;
00157         for (size_t i = 1, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00158         { (*cpy) << (*rhs)[i]; }
00159         return cpy;
00160       }
00161       // if rhs is another tag name and it matches this, return rhs
00162       else if (static_cast<Type_Selector*>(rhs_0)->name() == name())
00163       { return new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(*rhs); }
00164       // else the tag names don't match; return nil
00165       else
00166       { return 0; }
00167     }
00168     // else it's a tag name and a bunch of qualifiers -- just append them
00169     Compound_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(rhs->pstate());
00170     (*cpy) << this;
00171     (*cpy) += rhs;
00172     return cpy;
00173   }

00175   Compound_Selector* Selector_Qualifier::unify_with(Compound_Selector* rhs, Context& ctx)
00176   {
00177     if (name()[0] == '#')
00178     {
00179       for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00180       {
00181         Simple_Selector* rhs_i = (*rhs)[i];
00182         if (typeid(*rhs_i) == typeid(Selector_Qualifier) &&
00183             static_cast<Selector_Qualifier*>(rhs_i)->name()[0] == '#' &&
00184             static_cast<Selector_Qualifier*>(rhs_i)->name() != name())
00185           return 0;
00186       }
00187     }
00188     rhs->has_line_break(has_line_break());
00189     return Simple_Selector::unify_with(rhs, ctx);
00190   }

00192   Compound_Selector* Pseudo_Selector::unify_with(Compound_Selector* rhs, Context& ctx)
00193   {
00194     if (is_pseudo_element())
00195     {
00196       for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00197       {
00198         Simple_Selector* rhs_i = (*rhs)[i];
00199         if (typeid(*rhs_i) == typeid(Pseudo_Selector) &&
00200             static_cast<Pseudo_Selector*>(rhs_i)->is_pseudo_element() &&
00201             static_cast<Pseudo_Selector*>(rhs_i)->name() != name())
00202         { return 0; }
00203       }
00204     }
00205     return Simple_Selector::unify_with(rhs, ctx);
00206   }

00208   bool Compound_Selector::is_superselector_of(Compound_Selector* rhs)
00209   {
00210     To_String to_string;
00211 
00212     Simple_Selector* lbase = base();
00213     Simple_Selector* rbase = rhs->base();
00214 
00215     // Check if pseudo-elements are the same between the selectors
00216 
00217     set<string> lpsuedoset, rpsuedoset;
00218     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00219     {
00220       if ((*this)[i]->is_pseudo_element()) {
00221         string pseudo((*this)[i]->perform(&to_string));
00222         pseudo = pseudo.substr(pseudo.find_first_not_of(":")); // strip off colons to ensure :after matches ::after since ruby sass is forgiving
00223         lpsuedoset.insert(pseudo);
00224       }
00225     }
00226     for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00227     {
00228       if ((*rhs)[i]->is_pseudo_element()) {
00229         string pseudo((*rhs)[i]->perform(&to_string));
00230         pseudo = pseudo.substr(pseudo.find_first_not_of(":")); // strip off colons to ensure :after matches ::after since ruby sass is forgiving
00231         rpsuedoset.insert(pseudo);
00232       }
00233     }
00234     if (lpsuedoset != rpsuedoset) {
00235       return false;
00236     }
00237 
00238     // Check the Simple_Selectors
00239 
00240     set<string> lset, rset;
00241 
00242     if (!lbase) // no lbase; just see if the left-hand qualifiers are a subset of the right-hand selector
00243     {
00244       for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00245       {
00246         Selector* lhs = (*this)[i];
00247         // very special case for wrapped matches selector
00248         if (Wrapped_Selector* wrapped = dynamic_cast<Wrapped_Selector*>(lhs)) {
00249           if (wrapped->name() == ":matches(" || wrapped->name() == ":-moz-any(") {
00250             if (Selector_List* list = dynamic_cast<Selector_List*>(wrapped->selector())) {
00251               if (Compound_Selector* comp = dynamic_cast<Compound_Selector*>(rhs)) {
00252                 if (list->is_superselector_of(comp)) return true;
00253               }
00254             }
00255           }
00256         }
00257         // match from here on as strings
00258         lset.insert(lhs->perform(&to_string));
00259       }
00260       for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00261       { rset.insert((*rhs)[i]->perform(&to_string)); }
00262       return includes(rset.begin(), rset.end(), lset.begin(), lset.end());
00263     }
00264     else { // there's an lbase
00265       for (size_t i = 1, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00266       { lset.insert((*this)[i]->perform(&to_string)); }
00267       if (rbase)
00268       {
00269         if (lbase->perform(&to_string) != rbase->perform(&to_string)) // if there's an rbase, make sure they match
00270         { return false; }
00271         else // the bases do match, so compare qualifiers
00272         {
00273           for (size_t i = 1, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i)
00274           { rset.insert((*rhs)[i]->perform(&to_string)); }
00275           return includes(rset.begin(), rset.end(), lset.begin(), lset.end());
00276         }
00277       }
00278     }
00279     // catch-all
00280     return false;
00281   }
00282 
00283   bool Compound_Selector::operator==(const Compound_Selector& rhs) const {
00284     To_String to_string;
00285 
00286     // Check if pseudo-elements are the same between the selectors
00287 
00288     set<string> lpsuedoset, rpsuedoset;
00289     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00290     {
00291       if ((*this)[i]->is_pseudo_element()) {
00292         string pseudo((*this)[i]->perform(&to_string));
00293         pseudo = pseudo.substr(pseudo.find_first_not_of(":")); // strip off colons to ensure :after matches ::after since ruby sass is forgiving
00294         lpsuedoset.insert(pseudo);
00295       }
00296     }
00297     for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs.length(); i < L; ++i)
00298     {
00299       if (rhs[i]->is_pseudo_element()) {
00300         string pseudo(rhs[i]->perform(&to_string));
00301         pseudo = pseudo.substr(pseudo.find_first_not_of(":")); // strip off colons to ensure :after matches ::after since ruby sass is forgiving
00302         rpsuedoset.insert(pseudo);
00303       }
00304     }
00305     if (lpsuedoset != rpsuedoset) {
00306       return false;
00307     }
00308 
00309     // Check the base
00310 
00311     const Simple_Selector* const lbase = base();
00312     const Simple_Selector* const rbase = rhs.base();
00313 
00314     if ((lbase && !rbase) ||
00315       (!lbase && rbase) ||
00316       ((lbase && rbase) && (*lbase != *rbase))) {
00317       return false;
00318     }
00319 
00320 
00321     // Check the rest of the SimpleSelectors
00322     // Use string representations. We can't create a set of Simple_Selector pointers because std::set == std::set is going to call ==
00323     // on the pointers to determine equality. I don't know of a way to pass in a comparison object. The one you can specify as part of
00324     // the template type is used for ordering, but not equality. We also can't just put in non-pointer Simple_Selectors because the
00325     // class is intended to be subclassed, and we'd get splicing.
00326 
00327     set<string> lset, rset;
00328 
00329     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00330     { lset.insert((*this)[i]->perform(&to_string)); }
00331     for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs.length(); i < L; ++i)
00332     { rset.insert(rhs[i]->perform(&to_string)); }
00333 
00334     return lset == rset;
00335   }

00338     return *pLeft < *pRight;

00346   bool Complex_Selector::is_superselector_of(Complex_Selector* rhs)
00347   {
00348     Complex_Selector* lhs = this;
00349     To_String to_string;
00350     // check for selectors with leading or trailing combinators
00351     if (!lhs->head() || !rhs->head())
00352     { return false; }
00353     Complex_Selector* l_innermost = lhs->innermost();
00354     if (l_innermost->combinator() != Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF && !l_innermost->tail())
00355     { return false; }
00356     Complex_Selector* r_innermost = rhs->innermost();
00357     if (r_innermost->combinator() != Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF && !r_innermost->tail())
00358     { return false; }
00359     // more complex (i.e., longer) selectors are always more specific
00360     size_t l_len = lhs->length(), r_len = rhs->length();
00361     if (l_len > r_len)
00362     { return false; }
00363 
00364     if (l_len == 1)
00365     { return lhs->head()->is_superselector_of(rhs->base()); }
00366 
00367     // we have to look one tail deeper, since we cary the
00368     // combinator around for it (which is important here)
00369     if (rhs->tail() && lhs->tail() && combinator() != Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF) {
00370       Complex_Selector* lhs_tail = lhs->tail();
00371       Complex_Selector* rhs_tail = rhs->tail();
00372       if (lhs_tail->combinator() != rhs_tail->combinator()) return false;
00373       if (!lhs_tail->head()->is_superselector_of(rhs_tail->head())) return false;
00374     }
00375 
00376 
00377     bool found = false;
00378     Complex_Selector* marker = rhs;
00379     for (size_t i = 0, L = rhs->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00380       if (i == L-1)
00381       { return false; }
00382       if (lhs->head()->is_superselector_of(marker->head()))
00383       { found = true; break; }
00384       marker = marker->tail();
00385     }
00386     if (!found)
00387     { return false; }
00388 
00389     /*
00390       Hmm, I hope I have the logic right:
00391 
00392       if lhs has a combinator:
00393         if !(marker has a combinator) return false
00394         if !(lhs.combinator == '~' ? marker.combinator != '>' : lhs.combinator == marker.combinator) return false
00395         return lhs.tail-without-innermost.is_superselector_of(marker.tail-without-innermost)
00396       else if marker has a combinator:
00397         if !(marker.combinator == ">") return false
00398         return lhs.tail.is_superselector_of(marker.tail)
00399       else
00400         return lhs.tail.is_superselector_of(marker.tail)
00401     */
00402     if (lhs->combinator() != Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF)
00403     {
00404       if (marker->combinator() == Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF)
00405       { return false; }
00406       if (!(lhs->combinator() == Complex_Selector::PRECEDES ? marker->combinator() != Complex_Selector::PARENT_OF : lhs->combinator() == marker->combinator()))
00407       { return false; }
00408       return lhs->tail()->is_superselector_of(marker->tail());
00409     }
00410     else if (marker->combinator() != Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF)
00411     {
00412       if (marker->combinator() != Complex_Selector::PARENT_OF)
00413       { return false; }
00414       return lhs->tail()->is_superselector_of(marker->tail());
00415     }
00416     else
00417     {
00418       return lhs->tail()->is_superselector_of(marker->tail());
00419     }
00420     // catch-all
00421     return false;
00422   }

00424   size_t Complex_Selector::length()
00425   {
00426     // TODO: make this iterative
00427     if (!tail()) return 1;
00428     return 1 + tail()->length();

00431   Compound_Selector* Complex_Selector::base()
00432   {
00433     if (!tail()) return head();
00434     else return tail()->base();
00435   }

00437   Complex_Selector* Complex_Selector::context(Context& ctx)
00438   {
00439     if (!tail()) return 0;
00440     if (!head()) return tail()->context(ctx);
00441     Complex_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Complex_Selector(pstate(), combinator(), head(), tail()->context(ctx));
00442     cpy->media_block(media_block());
00443     cpy->last_block(last_block());
00444     return cpy;
00445   }

00447   Complex_Selector* Complex_Selector::innermost()
00448   {
00449     if (!tail()) return this;
00450     else         return tail()->innermost();
00451   }

00453   Complex_Selector::Combinator Complex_Selector::clear_innermost()
00454   {
00455     Combinator c;
00456     if (!tail() || tail()->length() == 1)
00457     { c = combinator(); combinator(ANCESTOR_OF); tail(0); }
00458     else
00459     { c = tail()->clear_innermost(); }
00460     return c;
00461   }

00463   void Complex_Selector::set_innermost(Complex_Selector* val, Combinator c)
00464   {
00465     if (!tail())
00466     { tail(val); combinator(c); }
00467     else
00468     { tail()->set_innermost(val, c); }
00469   }

00471   Complex_Selector* Complex_Selector::clone(Context& ctx) const
00472   {
00473     Complex_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Complex_Selector(*this);
00474     if (tail()) cpy->tail(tail()->clone(ctx));
00475     return cpy;
00476   }

00478   Complex_Selector* Complex_Selector::cloneFully(Context& ctx) const
00479   {
00480     Complex_Selector* cpy = new (ctx.mem) Complex_Selector(*this);
00481 
00482     if (head()) {
00483       cpy->head(head()->clone(ctx));
00484     }
00485 
00486     if (tail()) {
00487       cpy->tail(tail()->cloneFully(ctx));
00488     }
00489 
00490     return cpy;
00491   }

00507   void Selector_List::adjust_after_pushing(Complex_Selector* c)
00508   {

00518   // it's a superselector if every selector of the right side
00519   // list is a superselector of the given left side selector
00520   bool Complex_Selector::is_superselector_of(Selector_List *sub)
00521   {
00522     // Check every rhs selector against left hand list
00523     for(size_t i = 0, L = sub->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00524       if (!is_superselector_of((*sub)[i])) return false;
00525     }
00526     return true;
00527   }

00540   // it's a superselector if every selector on the right side
00541   // is a superselector of any one of the left side selectors
00542   bool Selector_List::is_superselector_of(Compound_Selector *sub)
00543   {
00544     // Check every lhs selector against right hand
00545     for(size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i) {
00546       if ((*this)[i]->is_superselector_of(sub)) return true;
00547     }
00548     return false;

00583   /* not used anymore - remove?
00584   Selector_Placeholder* Compound_Selector::find_placeholder()
00585   {
00586     if (has_placeholder()) {
00587       for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i) {
00588         if ((*this)[i]->has_placeholder()) return (*this)[i]->find_placeholder();
00589       }
00590       // return this;
00591     }
00592     return 0;
00593   }*/
00594 
00595   /* not used anymore - remove?
00596   Selector_Placeholder* Selector_Placeholder::find_placeholder()
00597   {
00598     return this;
00599   }*/
00600 
00601   vector<string> Compound_Selector::to_str_vec()
00602   {
00603     To_String to_string;
00604     vector<string> result;
00605     result.reserve(length());
00606     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00607     { result.push_back((*this)[i]->perform(&to_string)); }
00608     return result;
00609   }
00610 
00611   Compound_Selector* Compound_Selector::minus(Compound_Selector* rhs, Context& ctx)
00612   {
00613     To_String to_string(&ctx);
00614     Compound_Selector* result = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(pstate());
00615 
00616     // not very efficient because it needs to preserve order
00617     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i)
00618     {
00619       bool found = false;
00620       string thisSelector((*this)[i]->perform(&to_string));
00621       for (size_t j = 0, M = rhs->length(); j < M; ++j)
00622       {
00623         if (thisSelector == (*rhs)[j]->perform(&to_string))
00624         {
00625           found = true;
00626           break;
00627         }
00628       }
00629       if (!found) (*result) << (*this)[i];
00630     }
00631 
00632     return result;
00633   }

00635   void Compound_Selector::mergeSources(SourcesSet& sources, Context& ctx)
00636   {
00637     for (SourcesSet::iterator iterator = sources.begin(), endIterator = sources.end(); iterator != endIterator; ++iterator) {
00638       this->sources_.insert((*iterator)->clone(ctx));
00639     }
00640   }

00642   /* not used anymore - remove?
00643   vector<Compound_Selector*> Complex_Selector::to_vector()
00644   {
00645     vector<Compound_Selector*> result;
00646     Compound_Selector* h = head();
00647     Complex_Selector* t = tail();
00648     if (h) result.push_back(h);
00649     while (t)
00650     {
00651       h = t->head();
00652       t = t->tail();
00653       if (h) result.push_back(h);
00654     }
00655     return result;
00656   }*/

00658   Number::Number(ParserState pstate, double val, string u, bool zero)
00659   : Expression(pstate),
00660     value_(val),
00661     zero_(zero),
00662     numerator_units_(vector<string>()),
00663     denominator_units_(vector<string>()),
00664     hash_(0)
00665   {
00666     size_t l = 0, r = 0;
00667     if (!u.empty()) {
00668       bool nominator = true;
00669       while (true) {
00670         r = u.find_first_of("*/", l);
00671         string unit(u.substr(l, r - l));
00672         if (nominator) numerator_units_.push_back(unit);
00673         else denominator_units_.push_back(unit);
00674         if (u[r] == '/') nominator = false;
00675         if (r == string::npos) break;
00676         else l = r + 1;
00677       }
00678     }
00679     concrete_type(NUMBER);
00680   }
00681 
00682   string Number::unit() const
00683   {
00684     stringstream u;
00685     for (size_t i = 0, S = numerator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) {
00686       if (i) u << '*';
00687       u << numerator_units_[i];
00688     }
00689     if (!denominator_units_.empty()) u << '/';
00690     for (size_t i = 0, S = denominator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) {
00691       if (i) u << '*';
00692       u << denominator_units_[i];
00693     }
00694     return u.str();
00695   }
00696 
00697   bool Number::is_unitless()
00698   { return numerator_units_.empty() && denominator_units_.empty(); }
00699 
00700   void Number::normalize(const string& prefered)
00701   {
00702 
00703     // first make sure same units cancel each other out
00704     // it seems that a map table will fit nicely to do this
00705     // we basically construct exponents for each unit
00706     // has the advantage that they will be pre-sorted
00707     map<string, int> exponents;
00708 
00709     // initialize by summing up occurences in unit vectors
00710     for (size_t i = 0, S = numerator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) ++ exponents[numerator_units_[i]];
00711     for (size_t i = 0, S = denominator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) -- exponents[denominator_units_[i]];
00712 
00713     // the final conversion factor
00714     double factor = 1;
00715 
00716     // get the first entry of numerators
00717     // forward it when entry is converted
00718     vector<string>::iterator nom_it = numerator_units_.begin();
00719     vector<string>::iterator nom_end = numerator_units_.end();
00720     vector<string>::iterator denom_it = denominator_units_.begin();
00721     vector<string>::iterator denom_end = denominator_units_.end();
00722 
00723     // main normalization loop
00724     // should be close to optimal
00725     while (denom_it != denom_end)
00726     {
00727       // get and increment afterwards
00728       const string denom = *(denom_it ++);
00729       // skip already canceled out unit
00730       if (exponents[denom] >= 0) continue;
00731       // skip all units we don't know how to convert
00732       if (string_to_unit(denom) == UNKNOWN) continue;
00733       // now search for nominator
00734       while (nom_it != nom_end)
00735       {
00736         // get and increment afterwards
00737         const string nom = *(nom_it ++);
00738         // skip already canceled out unit
00739         if (exponents[nom] <= 0) continue;
00740         // skip all units we don't know how to convert
00741         if (string_to_unit(nom) == UNKNOWN) continue;
00742         // we now have two convertable units
00743         // add factor for current conversion
00744         factor *= conversion_factor(nom, denom);
00745         // update nominator/denominator exponent
00746         -- exponents[nom]; ++ exponents[denom];
00747         // inner loop done
00748         break;
00749       }
00750     }
00751 
00752     // now we can build up the new unit arrays
00753     numerator_units_.clear();
00754     denominator_units_.clear();
00755 
00756     // build them by iterating over the exponents
00757     for (auto exp : exponents)
00758     {
00759       // maybe there is more effecient way to push
00760       // the same item multiple times to a vector?
00761       for(size_t i = 0, S = abs(exp.second); i < S; ++i)
00762       {
00763         // opted to have these switches in the inner loop
00764         // makes it more readable and should not cost much
00765         if (exp.second < 0) denominator_units_.push_back(exp.first);
00766         else if (exp.second > 0) numerator_units_.push_back(exp.first);
00767       }
00768     }
00769 
00770     // apply factor to value_
00771     // best precision this way
00772     value_ *= factor;
00773 
00774     // maybe convert to other unit
00775     // easier implemented on its own
00776     try { convert(prefered); }
00777     catch (incompatibleUnits& err)
00778     { error(err.what(), pstate()); }
00779     catch (...) { throw; }
00780 
00781   }
00782 
00783   void Number::convert(const string& prefered)
00784   {
00785     // abort if unit is empty
00786     if (prefered.empty()) return;
00787 
00788     // first make sure same units cancel each other out
00789     // it seems that a map table will fit nicely to do this
00790     // we basically construct exponents for each unit
00791     // has the advantage that they will be pre-sorted
00792     map<string, int> exponents;
00793 
00794     // initialize by summing up occurences in unit vectors
00795     for (size_t i = 0, S = numerator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) ++ exponents[numerator_units_[i]];
00796     for (size_t i = 0, S = denominator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) -- exponents[denominator_units_[i]];
00797 
00798     // the final conversion factor
00799     double factor = 1;
00800 
00801     vector<string>::iterator denom_it = denominator_units_.begin();
00802     vector<string>::iterator denom_end = denominator_units_.end();
00803 
00804     // main normalization loop
00805     // should be close to optimal
00806     while (denom_it != denom_end)
00807     {
00808       // get and increment afterwards
00809       const string denom = *(denom_it ++);
00810       // check if conversion is needed
00811       if (denom == prefered) continue;
00812       // skip already canceled out unit
00813       if (exponents[denom] >= 0) continue;
00814       // skip all units we don't know how to convert
00815       if (string_to_unit(denom) == UNKNOWN) continue;
00816       // we now have two convertable units
00817       // add factor for current conversion
00818       factor *= conversion_factor(denom, prefered);
00819       // update nominator/denominator exponent
00820       ++ exponents[denom]; -- exponents[prefered];
00821     }
00822 
00823     vector<string>::iterator nom_it = numerator_units_.begin();
00824     vector<string>::iterator nom_end = numerator_units_.end();
00825 
00826     // now search for nominator
00827     while (nom_it != nom_end)
00828     {
00829       // get and increment afterwards
00830       const string nom = *(nom_it ++);
00831       // check if conversion is needed
00832       if (nom == prefered) continue;
00833       // skip already canceled out unit
00834       if (exponents[nom] <= 0) continue;
00835       // skip all units we don't know how to convert
00836       if (string_to_unit(nom) == UNKNOWN) continue;
00837       // we now have two convertable units
00838       // add factor for current conversion
00839       factor *= conversion_factor(nom, prefered);
00840       // update nominator/denominator exponent
00841       -- exponents[nom]; ++ exponents[prefered];
00842     }
00843 
00844     // now we can build up the new unit arrays
00845     numerator_units_.clear();
00846     denominator_units_.clear();
00847 
00848     // build them by iterating over the exponents
00849     for (auto exp : exponents)
00850     {
00851       // maybe there is more effecient way to push
00852       // the same item multiple times to a vector?
00853       for(size_t i = 0, S = abs(exp.second); i < S; ++i)
00854       {
00855         // opted to have these switches in the inner loop
00856         // makes it more readable and should not cost much
00857         if (exp.second < 0) denominator_units_.push_back(exp.first);
00858         else if (exp.second > 0) numerator_units_.push_back(exp.first);
00859       }
00860     }
00861 
00862     // apply factor to value_
00863     // best precision this way
00864     value_ *= factor;
00865 
00866   }
00867 
00868   // useful for making one number compatible with another
00869   string Number::find_convertible_unit() const
00870   {
00871     for (size_t i = 0, S = numerator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) {
00872       string u(numerator_units_[i]);
00873       if (string_to_unit(u) != UNKNOWN) return u;
00874     }
00875     for (size_t i = 0, S = denominator_units_.size(); i < S; ++i) {
00876       string u(denominator_units_[i]);
00877       if (string_to_unit(u) != UNKNOWN) return u;
00878     }
00879     return string();
00880   }

00883   bool Number::operator== (Expression* rhs) const
00884   {
00885     try
00886     {
00887       Number l(pstate_, value_, unit());
00888       Number& r = dynamic_cast<Number&>(*rhs);
00889       l.normalize(find_convertible_unit());
00890       r.normalize(find_convertible_unit());
00891       return l.unit() == r.unit() &&
00892              l.value() == r.value();
00893     }
00894     catch (std::bad_cast&) {}
00895     catch (...) { throw; }
00896     return false;
00897   }
00898 
00899   bool Number::operator== (Expression& rhs) const
00900   {
00901     return operator==(&rhs);
00902   }
00903 
00904   bool List::operator==(Expression* rhs) const
00905   {
00906     try
00907     {
00908       List* r = dynamic_cast<List*>(rhs);
00909       if (!r || length() != r->length()) return false;
00910       if (separator() != r->separator()) return false;
00911       for (size_t i = 0, L = r->length(); i < L; ++i)
00912         if (*elements()[i] != *(*r)[i]) return false;
00913       return true;
00914     }
00915     catch (std::bad_cast&) {}
00916     catch (...) { throw; }
00917     return false;
00918   }
00919 
00920   bool List::operator== (Expression& rhs) const
00921   {
00922     return operator==(&rhs);
00923   }
00924 
00925   size_t List::size() const {
00926     if (!is_arglist_) return length();
00927     // arglist expects a list of arguments
00928     // so we need to break before keywords
00929     for (size_t i = 0, L = length(); i < L; ++i) {
00930       if (Argument* arg = dynamic_cast<Argument*>((*this)[i])) {
00931         if (!arg->name().empty()) return i;
00932       }
00933     }
00934     return length();
00935   }
00936 
00937   Expression* Hashed::at(Expression* k) const
00938   {
00939     if (elements_.count(k))
00940     { return elements_.at(k); }
00941     else { return &sass_null; }
00942   }
